RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Leonardo Montecchi Professor Doutor no Instituto de Computao (IC) da Universidade Estadual de Campinas (UNICAMP). Possui doutorado em Cincia da Computao, Sistemas e Telecomunicaes (2014) pela Universit degli Studi di Firenze (Itlia), mestrado em Cincia da Computao (2010) e graduao em Cincia da Computao (2007) pela Universit degli Studi di Firenze (Itlia). 

Tem interesse de pesquisas em vrios aspectos da modelagem de sistemas complexos, incluindo modelos formais, anlise de desempenho e engenharia dirigida por modelos. Atualmente, investiga tcnicas de engenharia dirigida por modelo para apoiar o desenvolvimento e V&V de sistemas, com foco especial em sistemas e infraestruturas crticas. Outras reas de pesquisa em que involvido incluem tcnicas para mitigar a grandeza dos modelos e tcnicas inovadoras para modelagem de aspectos de segurana. 

J participou em vrios projetos de pesquisa internacionais, como o ARTEMIS-2008-1-100022 "CHESS", ARTEMIS-2012-1-333053 "CONCERTO", FP7-PEOPLE-2013-IRSES-612569 "DEVASSES" e FP7-ICT-2013-10-610535 "AMADEOS". Atualmente, est envolvido do projeto de mobilidade H2020-MSCA-RISE-2018-823788 "ADVANCE".
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Leonardo Montecchi is Assistant Professor at the Institute of Computing (IC) of the University of Campinas (UNICAMP). He owns a PhD in Computer Science, Systems and Telecommunications, received from University of Firenze, Italy, in 2014. He received his Master's and Bachelor's in Computer Science from the same university in 2010 and 2007, respectively.

His research interests revolve around different aspect of the modeling of complex systems, including formal models, performability analysis, and model-driven engineering. Currently, he focuses on applying model-driven engineering techniques to support the development and V&V of systems, with a particular focus on critical systems and infrastructures. Other research areas in which he is involved are techniques to mitigate model largeness, and innovative techniques for the modeling of security and software dependability aspects. 

He participated in differente international research projects, including ARTEMIS-2008-1-100022 "CHESS", ARTEMIS-2012-1-333053 "CONCERTO", FP7-PEOPLE-2013-IRSES-612569 "DEVASSES" and FP7-ICT-2013-10-610535 "AMADEOS". He is currently involved in the H2020 interchange project H2020-MSCA-RISE-2018-823788 "ADVANCE".

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CONCERTO: Guaranteed Component Assembly with Round Trip Analysis for Energy Efficient High-integrity Multi-core Systems
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
CONCERTO builds on the previous CHESS project results from the ARTEMIS programme, as well as the results of several other related projects. The project was co-funded by ARTEMIS Industry Association and National Governments, and incldued 15 partners (from both academic and industry) across 8 countries.
The work developed in the project follows the direction edtablished by CHESS: developing a reference multi-domain architectural framework for the development of component-based systems respecting non-functional properties like reliability and real-time. The CONCERTO project addressed several new concerns with respect to CHESS: extension to a system-level view, multi-criticality, multi-core platforms, integration of safety analyses, and others. New application domains were also included as use case, namely the petroleum and the medical domains. One of the outputs of this project are extesions to the open source Polarsys CHESS framework.
http://www.concerto-project.org/
https://artemis-ia.eu/project/47-concerto.html
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
CONCERTO builds on the previous CHESS project results from the ARTEMIS programme, as well as the results of several other related projects. The project was co-funded by ARTEMIS Industry Association and National Governments, and incldued 15 partners (from both academic and industry) across 8 countries.
The work developed in the project follows the direction edtablished by CHESS: developing a reference multi-domain architectural framework for the development of component-based systems respecting non-functional properties like reliability and real-time. The CONCERTO project addressed several new concerns with respect to CHESS: extension to a system-level view, multi-criticality, multi-core platforms, integration of safety analyses, and others. New application domains were also included as use case, namely the petroleum and the medical domains. One of the outputs of this project are extesions to the open source Polarsys CHESS framework.
http://www.concerto-project.org/
https://artemis-ia.eu/project/47-concerto.html
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: CONCERTO: Guaranteed Component Assembly with Round Trip Analysis for Energy Efficient High-integrity Multi-core Systems

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: TENACE: ProTEcting NAtional Critical Infrastructures from Cyber ThrEats
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
TENACE was a national project funded by the Italian Ministry of Education, University, and Research, and included 10 of the main Italian research groups on cyber security and critical infrastructure protection. The project investigated the protection of national critical infrastructures from cyber threats following a collaborative approach whenever appropriate. TENACE addressed three scenarios: financial infrastructures, power grid and transportation systems that represent three widely different settings with distinct interdepencies, threats, vulnerabilities and possible countermeasures. TENACE has the objective of defining collaborative technical and organizational methodologies to raise the protection of such CIs with the specific target of looking at the common steps in order to develop a unifying metodology and understanding the underground economics fuelling an attacker. The study of specific CI vulnerabilities and related attacks drove the development of algorithms, models, architectures and tools as the means to enable the effective protection of critical infrastructures enhancing their degree of security and dependability by considering a continuously evolving adversary. TENACE addressed cyber attacks, combination of cyber and physical attacks and cyber fraudes.
http://www.dis.uniroma1.it/~tenace/
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
TENACE was a national project funded by the Italian Ministry of Education, University, and Research, and included 10 of the main Italian research groups on cyber security and critical infrastructure protection. The project investigated the protection of national critical infrastructures from cyber threats following a collaborative approach whenever appropriate. TENACE addressed three scenarios: financial infrastructures, power grid and transportation systems that represent three widely different settings with distinct interdepencies, threats, vulnerabilities and possible countermeasures. TENACE has the objective of defining collaborative technical and organizational methodologies to raise the protection of such CIs with the specific target of looking at the common steps in order to develop a unifying metodology and understanding the underground economics fuelling an attacker. The study of specific CI vulnerabilities and related attacks drove the development of algorithms, models, architectures and tools as the means to enable the effective protection of critical infrastructures enhancing their degree of security and dependability by considering a continuously evolving adversary. TENACE addressed cyber attacks, combination of cyber and physical attacks and cyber fraudes.
http://www.dis.uniroma1.it/~tenace/

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: DEVASSES: DEsign, Verification and VAlidation of large scale, dynamic Service SystEmS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The DEVASSES project is a mobility project funded by the European Union's Seventh Framework Programme. The project aimed at taking a step forward in the design and deployment of large-scale, dynamic service-based software systems by supporting the transfer of knowledge on novel state of the art methods, techniques, and tools for both design-time and run-time verification and validation. The consortium includes: University of Coimbra (Portugal), University of Florence (Italy), Unicamp - University of Campinas (Brazil), and Federal University of Alagoas (Brazil). The project includes joint research activities, focused training activities, and joint workshops, designed to exploit complementary expertise and to create synergies among the partners, establishing the basis for sustainable future cooperation at different levels, including: co-advising of PhD students, joint organization of international events (workshops, conferences, summer schools, etc.), participation in bilateral project proposals, participation in large-scale international project proposals, etc.
http://devasses.dei.uc.pt/
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The DEVASSES project is a mobility project funded by the European Union's Seventh Framework Programme. The project aimed at taking a step forward in the design and deployment of large-scale, dynamic service-based software systems by supporting the transfer of knowledge on novel state of the art methods, techniques, and tools for both design-time and run-time verification and validation. The consortium includes: University of Coimbra (Portugal), University of Florence (Italy), Unicamp - University of Campinas (Brazil), and Federal University of Alagoas (Brazil). The project includes joint research activities, focused training activities, and joint workshops, designed to exploit complementary expertise and to create synergies among the partners, establishing the basis for sustainable future cooperation at different levels, including: co-advising of PhD students, joint organization of international events (workshops, conferences, summer schools, etc.), participation in bilateral project proposals, participation in large-scale international project proposals, etc.
http://www.devasses.eu/
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: DEVASSES: DEsign, Verification and VAlidation of large scale, dynamic Service SystEmS

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CHESS: Composition with Guarantees for High-integrity Embedded Software Components aSsembly
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The CHESS project is a project co-funded by the ARTEMIS Industry Association (ARTEMIS-IA) and National Governments. The objective of the project was to improve Model Driven Engineering practices and technologies to better address safety, reliability, performance, robustness and other extra-functional concerns in the development of embedded systems. The project involved 18 partners (both academic and industrial) from 6 different countries. My contribution was on devising techniques for automating dependability analysis starting from UML models. This activity invoved defining language extensions and defining and implementing model transformations. One of the output of the project is the "CHESS Framework", released as open source software under the Eclipse Polarsys initiative.
http://www.chess-project.org/
https://artemis-ia.eu/project/2-chess.html
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The CHESS project is a project co-funded by the ARTEMIS Industry Association (ARTEMIS-IA) and National Governments. The objective of the project was to improve Model Driven Engineering practices and technologies to better address safety, reliability, performance, robustness and other extra-functional concerns in the development of embedded systems. The project involved 18 partners (both academic and industrial) from 6 different countries. My contribution was on devising techniques for automating dependability analysis starting from UML models. This activity invoved defining language extensions and defining and implementing model transformations. One of the output of the project is the "CHESS Framework", released as open source software under the Eclipse Polarsys initiative.
http://www.chess-project.org/
https://artemis-ia.eu/project/2-chess.html
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: CHESS: Composition with Guarantees for High-integrity Embedded Software Components aSsembly

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ADVANCE: Addressing Verification and Validation Challenges in Future Cyber-Physical Systems
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: ADVANCE is an Horizon 2020 project, funded by the European Union under the Research and Innovation Staff Exchange (RISE) scheme, in which research is performed by exchange of researchers between the partners and transfer of knowledge activities. The project will study the the V&V methods and the data analysis techniques that are efficient and effective for the new challenges in cyber-physical systems. The goal of the project is to form an international network of organizations working on a joint research and training program. http://advance-rise.eu/
